intro: Phyteuma nigrum f. interruptum, commonly known as the black evening primrose. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae, characterized by its dark purple to black flowers and hairy stems. The plant is native to Europe and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It blooms in late summer, adding a striking visual contrast to garden landscapes.
